document.docAuthor: Khanjani, Mohammad, Izadi, Hamzeh, Fayaz, Bahman Asali, Raisi, Hosein, Rostami, Elaheh & Doğan, Salih
document.masterDocTitle: Stigmaeus boshroyehensis sp. nov. (Acari: Stigmaeidae) from eastern Iran, with re-description of Stigmaeus pilatus Kuznetzov

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Stigmaeus boshroyehensis sp. nov. (Acari: Stigmaeidae) from eastern Iran, with re-description of Stigmaeus pilatus Kuznetzov

Stigmaeus pilatus
Kuznetzov, 1978

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Female. Eyes present, postocular bodies large, dorsal shields smooth, median zonal and intercalary shields divided, marginal shields large, suranal shield entire, dorsal body setae unequal in length, median shield with two pairs of setae, h
3
absent, genua 3 ( 1 )- 3 ( 1 )- 1 - 1 ; femora 6 - 4 - 3 - 2 .

Description. Female (n = 3 ). Color in life red. Idiosoma oval. Length of body (including gnathosoma) 515 - 513-523 ; (excluding gnathosoma) 390–392 ; breadth 186–192 at level of seta c
2
; length of leg I 216–221 ; leg II 158–160 ; leg III 157 –160 , leg IV 183–192 .

Dorsum (
Figs. 10
): Prodorsal shield wide oblong, smooth and with three pairs of setae (
v
1
,
v
2
, sc
1
) and a pair of eyes 8–12 and postocular bodies ( pob ) 38–43 in diameter (
Fig. 10
), setae sc
2
on separate platelets; hysterosoma covered with longitudinal striations; all dorsal shields smooth, median shield with setae c
1
and d
1
, median zonal shield divided with seta e
1
, posterior margin of median shield smooth, no extending between median zonal shields; intercalary shield divided with f
1
, d
2
on long and elliptical shield; and e
2
located on almost rounded platelet, suranal shield entire with two pairs of setae ( h 1,2 ). Dorsal setae short except for setae
v
2
and c
2
which are longest. Humeral shield in ventral position between coxae II–III and setae c
2
situated ventrolaterally between coxae II–III. Setae
v
2
3.40–3.67 times longer than setae
v
1

Gnathosoma ( Figs. 12, 13 ): Chelicerae hinged at base, movable digit 72–75 , cheliceral base 71–73 ; palp coxa with supra coxal seta 4–5 (
Fig. 13
). Subcapitulum with two pairs of subcapitular setae, m 24–27 and n 18 ( 15–16 ), two pairs of adoral setae, or
1
12–13
, or
2
16–18
; distances: or

Fig. 13
). Palpi five segmented, palp tarsus with five simple setae + one solenidion (ω) 5–6 + one terminal tridentate eupathidium, tibia with two simple setae + one well developed claw 18–20 + one accessory claw 5–6 ; palp genu with two setae 32 –39, 17– 21 and palp femur with three setae 42 – 58, 33–40, 30– 32 (
Fig. 12
).
Male and immature stages. Not found.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 10–13.
Stigmaeus pilatus Kuznetzov
(Female): 10. dorsal view, 11. venteral view, 12. palp, 13. subcapitulum.

FIGURES 14–17.
Stigmaeus pilatus Kuznetzov
(Female): 14. leg I, 15. leg II, 16. leg III, 17. leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion. The Iranian specimens exhibit most characters of
S. pilatus
Kuznetzov, 1978
; however, in the original description and the Turkish specimens (
Doğan & Ayyıldız, 2003
), genu II has solenidion ĸ whereas it is lacking in Iranian specimens; posterior margin of median hysterosomal shield smooth in the Iranian specimens whereas projecting in between median zonal shields in the original descriptions. Comparisons between Iranian and Turkish specimens are given in table 2 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Metric data of Iranian and Turkish specimens of
S. Pilatus Kuznetzov, 1978
